properties.areaDesc: Northern Wayne; Luzerne; Southern Wayne; Delaware; Wyoming; Lackawanna
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 7 at 11:19AM EST until February 7 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton NY
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 3 inches.
Storm total snowfall of 3 to 7 inches are expected with the
highest amounts at higher elevations northwest of the Wyoming
Valley and in Delaware County. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...Lackawanna, Luzerne and Southern Wayne counties.

* WHEN...A band of heavy snow producing snowfall rates of 2 to 3
inches per hour will continue to move east during the midday
hours. The snow will become light early this afternoon and
continue through early this evening.

* IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult, especially at higher
elevations. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility
this afternoon. Isolated power outages possible this afternoon.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania
Turnpike Commission remind motorist to adjust speeds based on
driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania
roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadways,
and traffic conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING
